snippet.title: Real estate agents at the forefront of change
snippet.content: THE local branch of the REIQ was one of the driving forces behind the naming of the Sunshine Coast but even its most imaginative members could hardly have thought how much their industry would change over the next five decades. Of course, the value of property was always going to increase in the long term but did any of them forsee land behind the sand dunes of Kawana one day being home to tens of thousands of people or the sleepy main street of Noosa becoming known worldwide as a cosmopolitan destination? People like Nev Kane, who was involved in those early REIQ meetings and is still in business at 85 years of age, has watched the real estate world change dramatically. Mobile phones have replaced the two-way radios once used by the most progressive agents and where business was once generated mostly by window displays and newspaper advertising, now it's a world of websites and apps. The Henzell family has been at the forefront since 1935 when Caloundra was little more than a sleepy fishing village and even Brett Graham, who opened his own agency as recently as 1999, has seen fortunes fluctuate and the same block of land fetch as much as $450,000 and as little as $85,000 in the space of just a few years. This book does not pretend to be "the ultimate history of real estate on the Sunshine Coast" but, rather, a snapshot of the past 50 years through the eyes of people like Nev Kane, Brett Graham, the Henzells and Vicky Stewart, who began selling property because she was a single mum who needed a "family friendly" job and now owns her own business. They will tell you that the real estate game is full of highs and lows but it's a roller-coaster ride none of them can imagine getting off. Scenic amenity, abundant biodiversity and healthy waterways retained "The Sunshine Coast is different. It has its own personality." Professor Ian Lowe hopes the Coast will retain its natural appeal A real estate resurgence hit Nambour in the mid to late 1990s. Markets have plenty of fresh and locally made foods, arts and crafts Get off the couch and get social with our 10 Things To Do There's a live music gig to suit all music tastes in our Gig Guide Pauline Hanson declares latest reports another 'witch hunt' Celebrity chef accuses doctors of being in love with bread THE films in Rotten Tomatoes' Zero Per Cent Club. The words "hustler!" and "bitch!" were hurled. Celebs are bravely stepping into the Kitchen with Marco Pierre White Caloundra Chorale and Theatre Co is gearing up for The Secret Garden In 1967, Nev was a member of the REIQ Near North Coast branch. Seclusion without isolation on magical 31ha Noosa holding House and island for $3,500,000 Key buildings and international interest set to be revealed
